summary: Kenneth D. Klein was an employee of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available primarily consist of payroll records and related information, including salary adjustments and termination details. The records span from 1977, indicating his employment during that period. The documents do not provide specific details about his role within the HSCA or his direct involvement in the JFK assassination investigation beyond his employment.
significance: Kenneth D. Klein's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, which was tasked with investigating the JFK assassination. While the available documents focus on his payroll information, his role within the committee contributed to the overall investigation, even if the specifics of his contribution are not detailed in these records.
